Text: A Psalm of David, when he was in the wilderness of Judah.
Context: This title provides the historical setting for the psalm: David is in a physically and perhaps emotionally barren place, increasing the intensity of his spiritual thirst for God.

Text: O God, You are my God; earnestly I seek You; my soul thirsts for You, my body longs for You, in a dry and weary land without water.
Context: David expresses deep spiritual longing for God; his need for God is compared to a physical craving for water in a parched land.

Text: I have seen You in the sanctuary, to behold Your power and glory.
Context: Reflection on past experiences in the sanctuary where David has witnessed God's power and glory intensifies his current desire for God's presence.

Text: Because Your loving devotion is better than life, my lips will glorify You.
Context: David values God’s steadfast love above his own life, leading him to praise.

Text: So I will bless You as long as I live; at Your name, I will lift up my hands.
Context: A commitment to continual praise and a gesture of both reverence and petition.

Text: My soul will be satisfied as with the richest of foods; with joyful lips my mouth will praise You.
Context: Spiritual satisfaction is likened to being filled with the most lavish feast.

Text: When I remember You on my bed, I think of You through the watches of the night.
Context: David's contentment in God’s presence persists throughout the night, suggesting an ongoing meditation and comfort.

Text: For You have been my help, and in the shadow of Your wings I sing for joy.
Context: Joy is found in God’s past help and present protection, depicted as a bird sheltering its young.

Text: My soul clings to You; Your right hand upholds me.
Context: A declaration of steadfast faith and reliance on God's support.

Text: Those who seek my life will be destroyed; they shall go down to the depths of the earth.
Context: A prophecy of judgment upon David's enemies, implying divine vindication.

Text: They will be given over to the sword and become food for jackals.
Context: Further depiction of the impending doom for those who oppose God's anointed.

Text: But the king will rejoice in God; all who swear by His name will boast, for the mouths of liars will be silenced.
Context: A contrast between the fate of the righteous and the wicked, with a victorious outcome for those loyal to God.
